instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>P5VS3_LL</SIGNAL> shorted?
threads.message:
sitting here whit another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 

on <SIGNAL>P5VS3_LL</SIGNAL> i measure 0.010 in diode mode that is ground? (i think it should been around 0.138) have tray to remove <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> <CAPACITOR>C7290</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7291</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7293</CAPACITOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7260</TRANSISTOR> and still have the same can anybody pleas tell me next step?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>P5VS3_LL</SIGNAL> shorted?
threads.message: Remove L7260. I bet the short is on pin 1 which means 5V bus is fucked. Inject voltage there and see what heats up.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>P5VS3_LL</SIGNAL> shorted?
threads.message: Thank Duke for replay. Will tray to inject L7260 pin 1.do i need to replace <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> first?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>P5VS3_LL</SIGNAL> shorted?
threads.message: <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> should have never been pulled. L7260 would have been the first item to pull. Does not matter for finding the short of course. NEVER power the board on without <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> in place of course.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>P5VS3_LL</SIGNAL> shorted?
threads.message: Thank you Duke. Reason that I removed <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> was because i have pulsing volt on pin 10(I think it was) The short was on L7260. I found a faulty <CHIP>U4200</CHIP> replce it and replace <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>. Board is working.
